results.code:
138 
139 def _run_external(
140     cmd: List[str],
141     name: str,
142     pass_desc: str = "",
143     mode: str = "auto",
144 ) -> GateResult:
145     """
146     Run external tools like ruff/mypy/pytest.
147 
148     Rules:
149     - If the tool is not found: SKIPPED with guidance.
150     - If it returns code 0: PASS.
151     - Else: FAIL with captured output.
152     """
153     try:
154         proc = subprocess.run(
155             cmd,
156             capture_output=True,
157             text=True,
158         )
159     except FileNotFoundError:
160         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=False, mode=mode)
161         result.status = "SKIPPED"
162         result.info = "tool not installed"
163         result.details = (
164             f"{name}: SKIPPED because {cmd[0]!r} was not found on PATH.\n"
165             "What was attempted:\n"
166             f"- We tried to run {cmd!r}\n"
167             "Why it skipped:\n"
168             "- That tool is not installed in this environment.\n"
169             "How to enable:\n"
170             f"- Add {cmd[0]} to your dev requirements / venv.\n"
171         )
172         result.returncode = 0
173         result.stdout = None
174         result.stderr = None
175         return result
176 
177     out = (proc.stdout or "") + (proc.stderr or "")
178 
179     if proc.returncode == 0:
180         # add nicer PASS info
181         extra_info = pass_desc
182         if name.lower() == "tests":
183             # grab "23 passed" etc.
184             m = re.search(r"(\d+)\s+passed", out)
185             if m:
186                 extra_info = f"{m.group(1)} tests"
187 
188         result = GateResult(name=name, passed=True, mode=mode)
189         result.info = extra_info.strip()
190         result.details = out.strip()
191         result.returncode = proc.returncode
192         result.stdout = proc.stdout
193         result.stderr = proc.stderr
194         return result
195 
196     # non-zero exit - analyze the output for error details
197     errors, warnings, fixable = _analyze_output_for_counts(name, out)
198 
199     result = GateResult(
200         name=name,
201         passed=False,
202         errors=errors,
203         warnings=warnings,
204         fixable=fixable,
205         mode=mode,
206     )
207     result.info = "see details"
208     result.details = out.strip()
209     result.returncode = proc.returncode
210     result.stdout = proc.stdout
211     result.stderr = proc.stderr
212     return result
213
